availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph E. Mulkey (Monroe County, Kentucky farmer and justice of peace)

body.p: Monroe County, Kentucky, farmer, justice of the peace, and sheriff. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah A. Mulkey. Father of John T. Mulkey, Elizabeth Mulkey, Julia Mulkey, Hamilton S. Mulkey, Mary Mulkey, and Sarah B. Mulkey. Farmer in Monroe County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer and justice of the peace in Monroe County, Kentucky in 1860. Sheriff of Monroe County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 386B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 19.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, Precinct 6, p. 206A.
Find A Grave, "Joseph E. Mulkey (Sept 5, 1824-Feb 10, 1914)," Memorial #22338366, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22338366 (accessed April 23, 2020).
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's
Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Monroe County, KY, February 1864, p. 112, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
